section_title: Manipulation under anesthesia (MUA) (Evidence: pg no: 17, L577)
names: Manipulation under anesthesia (MUA) (Evidence: pg no: 17, L577)
Manipulation under anesthesia, shoulder joint (Evidence: pg no: 20, L719)
description: Manipulation under anesthesia (MUA) is considered medically necessary for post-traumatic, post-surgical, or idiopathic stiffness of the shoulder when ALL of the following criteria are met. (Evidence: pg no: 17, L577-L578)
scope: This guideline addresses shoulder arthroscopy and open procedures when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L373-L374)

documentation: Shoulder pain â‰¥ 4 on the VAS scale which interferes with age-appropriate activities of daily living (Evidence: pg no: 17, L579)
Reduced passive range of motion of the affected glenohumeral joint by at least 50% compared to unaffected shoulder (Evidence: pg no: 17, L580-L581)
Failure of at least 12 weeks of conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 17, L582)

codes.description: Manipulation under anesthesia, shoulder joint, including application of fixation apparatus (dislocation excluded) (Evidence: pg no: 20, L719)

notes: All open procedures of the shoulder are inclusive of manipulation under anesthesia. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L377)
